front.title: Private Extensions to the Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) for Asserted Identity within Trusted Networks

abstract.t: This document describes private extensions to SIP that enable anetwork of trusted SIP servers to assert the identity ofauthenticated users, and the application of existing privacymechanisms to the identity problem. The use of these extensions isonly applicable inside an administrative domain with previouslyagreed-upon policies for generation, transport and usage of suchinformation. This document does NOT offer a general privacy oridentity model suitable for use between different trust domains, oruse in the Internet at large.
